intro: Symphionema montanum, commonly known as the mountain symphionema, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. Symphionema montanum is often found in high-altitude environments and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
